feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle contains CSRF vulnerability
entry.content:
A flaw was found in Moodle in versions 3.11 to 3.11.3, 3.10 to 3.10.7, 3.9 to 3.9.10 and earlier unsupported versions. The "delete related badge" functionality did not include the necessary token check to prevent a CSRF risk.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-43559
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2021517
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=429099
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/20d41ebae4eb28269298504c68db511a05ec4969
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3jrj-x6cj-97cp

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Dolibarr ERP and CRM 13.0.2 allows XSS via object details, as demonstrated by > and < characters in the onpointermove attribute of a BODY element to the user-management feature.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-33618
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/releases
  • https://trovent.github.io/security-advisories/TRSA-2105-02/TRSA-2105-02.txt
  • https://trovent.io/security-advisory-2105-02
  • http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Nov/38
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fc6h-769x-gff5

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to RCE via unsafe deserialization
entry.content:
A flaw was found in Moodle in versions 3.11 to 3.11.3, 3.10 to 3.10.7, 3.9 to 3.9.10 and earlier unsupported versions. A remote code execution risk when restoring backup files was identified.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-3943
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2021963
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=429095
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/58e8ad852f9e75c8158e5bee02c273383f7d9865
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8jhp-2gcr-qw96

entry.title: [subhh/libconnect] libconnect Extension for Typo3 Vulnerable to XSS
entry.content:
The libconnect extension before 7.0.8 and 8.x before 8.1.0 for TYPO3 allows XSS.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-33157
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2022-010
  • https://github.com/subhh/libconnect/commit/8c582f3f6575f8744bf29f99bc1697ab8b7bd3af
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c8f2-5h29-8j2h

entry.title: [kitodo/presentation] SSRF in Kitodo.Presentation
entry.content:
An issue was discovered in the Kitodo.Presentation (aka dlf) extension before 2.3.2, 3.x before 3.2.3, and 3.3.x before 3.3.4 for TYPO3. A missing access check in an eID script allows an unauthenticated user to submit arbitrary URLs to this component. This results in SSRF, allowing attackers to view the content of any file or webpage the webserver has access to.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-24980
  • https://typo3.org/help/security-advisories
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2022-001
  • https://github.com/kitodo/kitodo-presentation/commit/059be3f82b08c60cbb798986cd3ff22dbf60a5e4
  • https://github.com/kitodo/kitodo-presentation/commit/4a20621afc30778ba3b045be5110353cf4fd4fd4
  • https://github.com/kitodo/kitodo-presentation/commit/9700478b46445f562c3e2051d61565d779f59275
  • https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PHP-KITODOPRESENTATION-2407280
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x832-r2rj-4g5p

entry.title: [aimeos/aimeos-typo3] Aimeos Typo3 extension contains XSS vulnerability
entry.content:
The aimeos (aka Aimeos shop and e-commerce framework) extension before 19.10.12 and 20.x before 20.10.5 for TYPO3 allows XSS via a backend user account.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-28380
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2021-003
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-73wv-rgj7-vjj9

entry.title: [aimeos/aimeos-typo3] Aimeos Typo3 extension contains XSS vulnerability

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS XSS via Survey Blocks
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) before 8.5.5 allows remote authenticated users to conduct XSS attacks via a crafted survey block. This requires at least Editor privileges.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-28145
  • https://documentation.concrete5.org/developers/introduction/version-history/855-release-notes
  • https://www.concrete5.org/developers/security
  • https://github.com/S1lkys/CVE-2021-40101
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7388-7vq2-m4f4

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Vulnerable to Reflected XSS
entry.content:
It was found in Moodle before version 3.10.1 that some search inputs were vulnerable to reflected XSS due to insufficient escaping of search queries.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-20183
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=417166
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/dc9de7b0d487b73c23c221dc0b8b6e01654921f3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xhfx-rm8q-c3xv

entry.title: [nilsteampassnet/teampass] TeamPass information exposure vulnerability
entry.content:
TeamPass prior to 3.0.10 allows unauthenticated actors to view application-specific and user data and files by viewing an endpoint directory listing.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-3553
  • https://github.com/nilsteampassnet/teampass/commit/e9f90b746fdde135da3c7fbe4fa22fe2bd32e66b
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/857f002a-2794-4807-aa5d-2f340de01870
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2rhg-hqq9-8xjh

entry.title: [pimcore/customer-management-framework-bundle] Pimcore Customer Management Framework vulnerable to Improper Authorization in Rules Controller
entry.content:
Impact

The product performs authorization checks incorrectly when an unauthorized actor tries to access a resource or perform an actions.

The attacker can view and freely perform actions to add, modify, or delete rules.

Patches

Update to version 3.4.1 or apply this patch manually https://github.com/pimcore/customer-data-framework/commit/f15668c86db254e86ba7ac895bc3cdd1a2a3cc45.patch

Workarounds

Apply https://github.com/pimcore/customer-data-framework/commit/f15668c86db254e86ba7ac895bc3cdd1a2a3cc45.patch manually.

References

https://huntr.dev/bounties/1dcb4f01-e668-4aa3-a6a3-838532e500c6/

References

  • https://github.com/pimcore/customer-data-framework/security/advisories/GHSA-vx35-f379-4q49
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-3574
  • https://github.com/pimcore/customer-data-framework/commit/f15668c86db254e86ba7ac895bc3cdd1a2a3cc45
  • https://github.com/pimcore/customer-data-framework/commit/f15668c86db254e86ba7ac895bc3cdd1a2a3cc45.patch
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/1dcb4f01-e668-4aa3-a6a3-838532e500c6
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/1dcb4f01-e668-4aa3-a6a3-838532e500c6/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vx35-f379-4q49

entry.title: [wallabag/wallabag] Wallabag vulnerable to Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
entry.content:
A vulnerability was found in wallabag 2.5.4. It has been declared as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /config of the component Profile Config. The manipulation of the argument Name leads to allocation of resources. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The associated identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-233359. NOTE: The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-3566
  • https://github.com/ctflearner/Vulnerability/blob/main/WALLABAG/NAME-LIMIT.md
  • https://vuldb.com/?ctiid.233359
  • https://vuldb.com/?id.233359
  • https://youtu.be/ouwud0PlHkE
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6qq7-3hqc-p5w4

entry.title: [nilsteampassnet/teampass] TeamPass Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Generic in GitHub repository nilsteampassnet/teampass prior to 3.0.10.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-3565
  • https://github.com/nilsteampassnet/teampass/commit/820bb49a362a566c9038e4a3048b26d654babb0e
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/fcf46e1f-2ab6-4057-9d25-cf493ab09530
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-524r-w8fx-hqg3
